title: MIMEQA: Towards Socially-Intelligent Nonverbal Foundation Models
author: Hengzhi Li (Massachusetts Institute of Technology), Megan Tjandrasuwita (Massachusetts Institute of Technology), Yi R. Fung (Massachusetts Institute of Technology), Armando Solar-Lezama (Massachusetts Institute of Technology), Paul Pu Liang (Massachusetts Institute of Technology), ..., Paul Pu Liang (Massachusetts Institute of Technology)
relevance_why: The methodologies for understanding nonverbal cues and social dynamics can be adapted to enhance audio-visual integration, which is important for improving generative models in audio tasks.
background: The study introduces a dataset and benchmark called MIMEQA to evaluate how AI models understand nonverbal social cues within mime performances, which are devoid of spoken language.
contribution: MIMEQA introduces a structured dataset focused on mime performances to evaluate and benchmark nonverbal social reasoning capabilities of AI models, achieving a low average accuracy of 15-30% on evaluations.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing models predominantly rely on language-centric approaches for social understanding, often failing in nonverbal contexts.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work emphasizes nonverbal communication, using mime performances as a unique challenge to enhance AI's understanding of social interactions.

key_innovation: Utilizes mime videos as a novel dataset to assess AI's capability to interpret social cues absent of verbal context, thereby pushing the envelope in social intelligence benchmarks.
real_world_impact: Improving AI's ability to interpret nonverbal communication could enhance its applications in mental health support, educational tools, and social agents role in caregiving.
limitations: The dataset is limited in diversity and scope, focusing primarily on Western cultures, which may restrict generalizability.

new_terms.mime: **Mime** refers to a theatrical performance style that conveys a narrative through gestures and body movements without spoken language.
